column4: wondering why people on Ubuntu bother with kde, seeing as gnome is "standard" ?
sure, and I respect that, just I choose to be lazy :D
points out these config lines belong in /etc/modules.d/tulip - not /etc/mocules
a world executable /root does appear interesting - would be better not
you shouldn't be needing to use esd
yes? so just turn it off in sound prefs?
afaik you have to enable esd to have system sounds. What's the real issue?
the issue is system sounds don't work
also various sound problems - amarok won't mix with audio from flash
that's symptomatic of Flash 7; is that the Flash version you're using?
nope, from macromedia, anyways, I"ll have a bit of a poke around
do you still have flashplugin-nonfree installed?
nope - the install for flash 9 is a straight cut/paste from https://help.ubuntu.com/community/RestrictedFormats
all fixed - esd wasn't running - because I had a leftover ~/.asoundrc.asoundconf file
